vogar

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • vogar.Console
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Log
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Console.MultiplexingConsole, Console.StreamingConsole

    public abstract class Console
extends java.lang.Object
implements Log
    Controls, formats and emits output to the command line. This class emits output in two modes:
    • Streaming output prints as it is received, but cannot support multiple concurrent output streams.
    • Multiplexing buffers output until it is complete and then prints it completely.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  Console.Color 
      (package private) static class  Console.CurrentLine
      Status of a currently-in-progress line of output.
      (package private) static class  Console.MultiplexingConsole
      This console buffers output, only printing when a result is found.
      (package private) static class  Console.StreamingConsole
      This console prints output as it's emitted.

      • streamOutput

        public abstract void streamOutput(java.lang.String outcomeName,
                java.lang.String output)
        Appends the action output immediately to the stream when streaming is on, or to a buffer when streaming is off. Buffered output will be held and printed only if the outcome is unsuccessful.

      • flushBufferedOutput

        protected void flushBufferedOutput(java.lang.String outcomeName)
        Hook to flush anything streamed via streamOutput(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
